info.author: marcell marosvolgyi
info.description:
=========================
Framebuffer python module
=========================

What is this?
=============

Python module for drawing in the framebuffer in linux console. Some convenience functions like poly, line, rect, arc and a character generator added. Has a rudimentary multiple drawing-surface manager (wouldn't call it windows yet). 

All administration and access to drawing functions through python, actual drawing is done by a helper function written in c. 

Jacksupport
-----------

The package supports JACK (Jack Audio Connection Kit) through a built-in Jack module.  

Background
==========

Wrote this as part of an audioplayer project raspberry pi/wolfson pi. needed a framebuffer audioscope, phase plotter, while being able to use curses based progs simultaneously.

Examples
========

https://plus.google.com/104940739538517041637/posts/7MvXUwmBeYD

http://youtu.be/67yfT6_7Ysw

http://youtu.be/73tXCdqdINU

http://youtu.be/5WeqTS04wV8
info.keywords: python, framebuffer, linux, wavefront, svg, raspberry pi, wolfson pi
info.name: fbpy
info.html_description:
What is this?

Python module for drawing in the framebuffer in linux console. Some convenience functions like poly, line, rect, arc and a character generator added. Has a rudimentary multiple drawing-surface manager (wouldn’t call it windows yet).

All administration and access to drawing functions through python, actual drawing is done by a helper function written in c.

Jacksupport

The package supports JACK (Jack Audio Connection Kit) through a built-in Jack module.

Background

Wrote this as part of an audioplayer project raspberry pi/wolfson pi. needed a framebuffer audioscope, phase plotter, while being able to use curses based progs simultaneously.
